discussion.content: A- In a nutshell, there is no direct relationship between a Lead/Contact (etc.) and a Salesforce Campaign in the Salesforce data model

Selected Answer: B
A Lead is related to a Campaign via an object called Campaign Member. When "deleting" a Lead from a Campaign, you are effectively deleting the Campaign Member record, not the Lead record itself

Selected Answer: B
I created a lead and then a campaign, then added that lead to the campaign. When I deleted the lead from the campaign member list, it was still available in lead records, and wasnt sent to the BIN
A Lead is related to a Campaign via an object called Campaign Member. When "deleting" a Lead from a Campaign, you are effectively deleting the Campaign Member record, not the Lead record itself.

It will delete the lead record itself.It will be in recycle bin for 15 days and can be recovered. If you are working on a small scale and you want to keep the lead but remove the association, you could go to the Lead(s) in question and under the related list of Campaigns simply delete the Campaign association

It just deletes the linkage between the Lead object and the Campaign object.
The alert states: "Are you sure you want to remove 1 selected member from this campaign?"
The Lead is still present, but now not linked to that Campaign.

comments.content: the record won't be deleted, check the link again

discussion.content: when you remove a lead from campaign.....the record is not deleted itself.so false

comments.content: Thank you for this Arya1234. This question is not clear enough. Most would consider something in the recycle bin as deleted...The recycle bin gets purged every 15 days, at least in SF Classic...couldn't find it defined for Lightning so maybe we can assume it is the same.
Record moving into recycle bin is as good as deleting the record. It is no more accessible to anyone unless it is restored. Shouldn't the answer be True?
I also think the answer should be A.
No, it just means that it's no longer associated with said campaign.

discussion.content:
When you delete a lead, the lead record moves to recycle bin . Associated notes, attachments and activities are deleted along with the lead.
If we restore the lead then all are restored as well.

questions.question_text: When you Delete a lead from a campaign, it deletes the lead record itself.

choices.B: Can be used to insert,update,delete or extract SF records
choices.D: Can be used to read,extract and load data from CSV
choices.E: Can be used to read,extract and load data from any MS office file
choices.A: Can be used to insert or extract SF records
choices.C: Can be used only to update and delete SF records

comments.content: But without read and extract, how will SF know what to load?

discussion.content: D is not correct. Data loader load data into SF from CSV. But don't read or extract from CSV

questions.question_text: Identify the statements that define Apex data loader?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.admin_exportdata.htm&type=5
If your org uses person accounts and you are exporting contacts, person account records are included in the contact data. However, the contact data only includes the fields shared by contacts and person accounts.

If your org uses person accounts and you are exporting contacts, person account records are included in the contact data. However, the contact data only includes the fields shared by contacts and person accounts.
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.admin_exportdata.htm&type=5

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements is true about person accounts in backup exports?

choices.A: If your organization uses person accounts and you're exporting contacts, person account records are included in the contact data. However, the contact data only includes the fields shared by contacts and person accounts.
choices.B: If your organization uses person accounts and you're exporting contacts, person account records are not included in the contact data.
choices.C: If your organization uses person accounts and you're exporting contacts, person account records are included in the contact data. The export includes all fields from person accounts.
